content.description: Another short route with a brief crux. Sharing a start with Lizard of Oz, this route breaks right below the first bolt with good holds to a rail feature and a long move to a slopey pinch. After the crux the route backs of considerably to the anchors.
content.location: Same start as Lizard of Oz on the southern most corner of the wall.

content.description: Powerful but short route that moves through an overhang for the first 15' then follows moderate rock to the anchors. Currently this route has a very high first bolt; a stick clip is highly recommended. This will be alleviated with another bolt in the future.
content.location: On the most downhill face in the Park and to the left of the crack in the center of the face.

content.description: Bouldering on a rope.. Stick clip the high first bolt. Starts beneath a large arete feature on positive holds. Work up and left to a good hold then launch into a short but sweet section of squeezing up the refrigerator sized overhang feature. Clip the second bolt then run it on jugs to the anchors.Â
content.location: The southern corner of the wall. The large blocky arete is an obvious feature.

content.description: This link up is probably the best route on the wall. Clip the uber high first bolt of Renal Excellence; work the start until you can traverse left on crimps below the bolt. Cool moves lead into the second bolt of Slither Vision then to the chains.
content.location: Starts in the middle of wall.

content.description: Short, well featured face with the crux right at the first bolt. The anchors are shared with both the crack and Renal Excellence.
content.location: The downhill side of the the most downhill large boulder. The line is to the right of the crack in the middle of the face.

content.description: A shady jumble of boulders a short walk from the Trading Co. on flat ground. A good assortment of boulder problems and a handful of roped climbs exist in this secluded zone. The area is a work in progress with development ongoing. Currently there are only two bolted lines on one of the boulders, it may receive a couple more in the future. Bouldering is all around the area with a few established problems existing but little to no information about them. The routes are on the furthest downhill side of the area where there is a nice bench to loiter on. WARNING: This area sits down range from HCR's shooting facilities. The typical times for their shooting activities are Monday mornings and Thursday evenings. Exercise caution and common sense when heading to the crag and avoid completely if the range is active.
